intro: Condea undulata, commonly known as the wavy condea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive wavy, undulating leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color, arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or forest understory environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
